SENT.plain: One hundred and sixty four patients with ulcerative colitis in remission were entered into a double blind, double dummy trial comparing olsalazine 500 mg bd and sulphasalazine 1 g bd
Clinical examination, sigmoidoscopy and rectal biopsy were performed at 0, three, and six months
Sixteen of 82 (19.5%) patients relapsed on olsalazine and 10/82 (12.2%) relapsed on sulphasalazine
The difference was not statistically significant (p = 0.1632)
Adverse events were minor and were similar in both groups
No haematological or biochemical abnormalities were detected
Thus, olsalazine is as effective as sulphasalazine for preventing a relapse of ulcerative colitis
